self, not trusting to his generals, moved with all the Guards to the field of battle, afraid of letting a ready victim escape, and Bagrati6n's four thousand men merrily lighted campfires, dried and warmed themselves, cooked their porridge for the first time for three days, and not one of them knew or imagined what was in store for him. 
BETWEEN three and four o'clock in the after- noon Prince Andrew, who had persisted in his request to Kutuzov, arrived at Grunth and re- ported himself to Bagr
